subject: p19715857
History: An-year-old man with fever and elevated white count.
Impression: AP chest compared to and : Previous mild-to-moderate pulmonary edema has substantially cleared. The residual opacification in the left lung base is a candidate for possible pneumonia, and should be followed. Pleural effusions are small and unchanged. Moderate cardiomegaly is stable. Mediastinal vascular engorgement has improved slightly. No pneumothorax.
